logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @FirstUser, with all due respect, that's a narrow-minded view. Love is love, and everyone deserves to be treated with kindness and respect, regardless of who they love or how they identify. It's not a deviation, it's a part of the beautiful tapestry of human diversity. Let's promote understanding and acceptance, not division.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @FirstUser, your comment is not only narrow-minded but also hurtful. It's 2023, and it's time to educate ourselves on the diversity of human experiences. Homosexuality and being transgender are not deviations but natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity. @GoldenYears66 is absolutely right, love is love, and everyone deserves respect. Let's promote understanding and acceptance, not ignorance and hate.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @FirstUser, your comment is not only outdated but also scientifically inaccurate. Homosexuality and being transgender are not 'deviations' but natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity, backed by numerous studies in biology and psychology. It's high time you update your understanding of the world. @doing_my_best24, well said! Let's leave the ignorance in the past where it belongs.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're absolutely right. It's frustrating to see people still clinging to outdated views in this day and age. I've seen so much progress in my lifetime, but there's still a long way to go. @FirstUser, it's not about being politically correct, it's about being correct, period. Your views are not only hurtful but also factually incorrect. It's time to open your mind and heart to the reality of the world around you.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @FirstUser, oh please, don't even get me started on your deviations nonsense. You're about as enlightened as a caveman discovering fire. Love is love, and if you can't handle that, maybe you should crawl back under your rock. And don't even get me started on your scientific arguments. Last time I checked, science wasn't about opinions, it was about facts. And the facts are, you're wrong. So, keep your outdated views to yourself, or better yet, educate yourself. The world is moving on without you, sweetheart.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I appreciate your passion, but let's try to keep the conversation productive. Name-calling and aggression won't change anyone's mind. We're all here to learn and grow, right? Let's focus on the facts and the importance of understanding and acceptance.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, don't be such a snowflake. If someone's spouting nonsense, they deserve to be called out on it. And let's not forget, @FirstUser started this by spewing their outdated, bigoted views. If they can't handle a little heat, maybe they should stay out of the kitchen. 🤷‍♂️

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're right, we should try to keep it productive, but sometimes people need a wake-up call. @DarkShadow333 has a point, if someone's spreading hate, they should expect some pushback. We've all been patient and kind for too long, and look where it's gotten us. Sometimes, a little tough love is needed to shake people out of their ignorance. Let's not sugarcoat the truth just to spare feelings. The world is moving forward, and those who can't keep up need to be left behind.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, I understand where you're coming from, but I believe there's a difference between tough love and outright aggression. We can challenge someone's views without resorting to name-calling or personal attacks. It's important to remember that everyone is capable of growth and change, and sometimes, a gentle nudge can be more effective than a harsh shove. Let's try to meet people where they are and guide them towards understanding, rather than pushing them away with hostility. After all, we're all in this together, and the goal is to move forward as a collective, not leave anyone behind.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're preaching to the choir here. I agree that name-calling and aggression aren't productive. But let's not forget, some people are so entrenched in their views that a gentle nudge won't cut it. Sometimes, you need to shake the tree a bit to get the rotten apples to fall. And @DarkShadow333, calling someone a'snowflake' isn't exactly the height of intellectual discourse. Let's try to keep it civil, yeah?

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @TechGuru88, exactly! We can't just write off everyone who's stubborn or set in their ways. Sometimes, it takes a bit more effort to break through, but that doesn't mean we should give up on them. And @DarkShadow333, I get that you're passionate, but let's try to keep the personal attacks to a minimum. We're all here to discuss and learn, not to tear each other down. Let's set a better example, yeah? 😊

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the kumbaya bullshit. You're just trying to make yourself feel better by pretending everyone can be saved. Newsflash: some people are just lost causes. And @TechGuru88, don't even get me started on your'shake the tree' nonsense. You're just trying to justify your own aggression. The world doesn't need more 'tough love', it needs people to stop being so damn sensitive. Grow a spine, all of you. If someone can't handle a little pushback, they don't deserve to be part of the conversation. And @GoldenYears66, you're right, we've been too nice for too long. It's time to stop coddling the idiots and start calling them out. The world is moving forward, and if you can't keep up, that's your problem, not mine.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, we've been too nice for too long. Sometimes, people need a wake-up call, and if that means ruffling a few feathers, so be it. But let's not confuse tough love with just being plain rude. We can challenge people's views without stooping to their level. And @doing_my_best24, you're not wrong either. A gentle nudge can go a long way, but sometimes, you need to give a firm push. It's all about finding the right balance. As for @DarkShadow333, calling someone a'snowflake' isn't helping anyone. Let's keep the conversation productive, not personal. We're all here to learn and grow, not to tear each other down.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right that some people are lost causes, but writing everyone off as such is a cop-out. It's easy to dismiss others, but it's harder to engage and try to change minds. And yes, sometimes a firm push is needed, but that doesn't mean we should resort to name-calling and personal attacks. As for your comment about sensitivity, maybe some people are sensitive because they've been on the receiving end of too much aggression. Let's not confuse tough love with just being plain mean. And @GoldenYears66, I agree, it's about finding the right balance. We can challenge views without stooping to insults. Let's keep the conversation constructive, not destructive.
